ygData.subject: Re: Specialization
ygData.msgSnippet: Hybrid spells? That s the single worst thing that could happen to the game imo. Definitely the first step down the slippery slope towards the tank mage world
ygData.messageBody:
Hybrid spells? That's the single worst thing that could happen to the game
imo. Definitely the first step down the slippery slope towards the tank mage
world of UO. Classes are unique, I truly hope they stick to their guns and
keep it that way.

Trev

-----Original Message-----
From: Robin McCaig <twister@...>
To: Research <EQ_spell_research@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, May 28, 1999 3:41 PM
Subject: [EQ_spell_research] Specialization


>From: "Robin McCaig" <twister@...>
>
>I hear that when Specialization come in that we will be able to cast the
>spell using less mana depending on what we are specializing in. That being
>the case, If we specialize in a certain area such as conjuration, will we
>get new spells such as summon food and water, etc. If they decide to let
us
>have hybrid spells from other races, it seems to me like they should limit
>the spells the wizard gets depending on which area of specialization he is
>in. If I wated to get SoW for example, I would have to train in the
>specialization spell trait that is used when SoW is cast (alteration,
>divination, etc.). This would allow us to get hybrid spells without making
>us too powerful, and allow the wizard player to be able to be a more well
>rounded profession rather than being so dependant on others to buff and
>group with. I don't know about you, but there are times when I am playing
>and no one is online who wants to group with me. This can be frustrating
>cause we are not good at melee.
>
>Just my two cents worth.
>
